column10: Female driver turn R on red from S Stuart onto S. Arl Mill. Crosswalk signal LIT. WHILE I was in the EB lane she was 80% thru her turn and in the far lane before she stopped only b/c I put my hand up to stop her from HITTING ME. Gray sedan VA # 13658H

This happens ALL the time. We need yellow flashing signals like @ S Quincy and Windgate. The Campbell Ave crosswalk gets 100-fold the foot traffic over those crossings. people r  focused on trying to get thru nearby lights and  don’t see the crosswalk
column26: 2720 S Arlington Mill Dr 209 Arlington VA 22207

column10: I was crossing S. Arlington Mill Dr. from north to south at Campbell St. I had reached the median. When I set my foot into the second half of the crosswalk, cars in both lanes traveling west on S. Arlington Mill Dr. drove right in front of me.
column21: This happens all the time. There need to be flashing yellow lights here just says there are 0.2 mile up the road at Arlington Mill Drive and South Oxford. PLEASE!!!

column10: I was a pedestrian in a crosswalk over S. Arlington Mill Dr. from the north to the south side at Campbell Avenue. While in the middle of the crosswalk over the westbound lane a car drove right behind me while I was still in the crosswalk not having reached even the median strip. It did not even slow down so may not have even seen me. Similar incidents happen ALL the time. There are SO many pedestrians crossing here, especially because of the Shirlington retail/restaurants, brewery and the dog park. I’ve lived in the neighborhood since 2016 and it has gotten worse. Drivers, especially those in the westbound lane (where the road curves preceding the crosswalk), are focused on the traffic signal at S. Arlington Mill Dr. and “Driveway” such that the crosswalk does NOT register. For pedestrian safety before someone gets seriously injured, we need flashing lights installed here !!!! PLEASE!!!!
column21:
PLEASE let’s beg the county to install yellow flashing lights here. This Crosswalk is preceded by a curvature in the road on the westbound side and is SO much more heavily used than the Xwalk 0.1 mile down the street at Windgate (around 2600 S Arlington Mill Dr),
where a flashing signal was installed. If these things happen to me as often as they do, dangerous events are occurring with incredible frequency.
column26: 2720 S. Arlington Mill Dr. #209 Arlington VA 22206

column10: A Red BMW sedan was speeding as my partner and I were in the crosswalk and stopped less than a foot away from my partner, almost hitting my dog and continued speeding
